summary: That’s one of the most heartbreaking scene of the Black Widow because we can clearly see that Bruce, as sweet as he is, is...
caption:
That’s one of the most heartbreaking scene of the Black Widow because we can clearly see that Bruce, as sweet as he is, is asking the question because he half-expects the answer to be ‘no’. Because he can’t grasp the fact that a grown woman would use a little girl to draw the attention of grown men. But Natasha answers with ‘I did’.

Natasha is honest with her mark for once, she’s brutally honest even. She tells him like she lived it. Being used by grown adults to lure or charm other grown adult, entirely disregarding the age of the child is the story of her life. She confesses in him even though he asked his question like the obvious answer would’ve been ‘no’, even though he judges her past by asking that question.

I’m sorry but whoever says that Scarlett Johansson doesn’t portray emotions in a believable way on screen, is a moron. You can see all the different emotions that go through her eyes in those two seconds. You can see questions in her eyes, you can see fear of judgment, you can see honesty, rawness and and and don’t get me started on her tone and voice in that short sentence. You can freaking see all the Black Widow’s horrible past in the Red Room in her eyes and hear it in her voice, but yeah let’s talk about the fact that Steve Rogers scraped his freaking diner plate of a shield because that’s much more interesting right …


The Avengers (movie) 2012 - 16:59:00 min

title: Leave - Bruce x Natasha
body:
Title: Leave

Pairing: Bruce Banner x Natasha Romanoff

Word Count: 965

Warnings: Angst

Summary: Natasha finds Bruce and questions him on his intentions on leaving her and the rest of the team.

Authors Note: im so sorry I haven’t been active lately I just haven’t had any motivation to write tbh so here have this piece of trash…


“Bruce, I came all this way because i love you. You can’t just turn me away now. After everything!” Natasha said desperately, she hated the way she sounded but she couldn’t care anymore. She couldn’t leave him here.

Bruce stumbled backwards, backing away as far as he could from her. Thumping hardly against the bench behind him. He had to get away. He couldn’t be here. Not with her. Not right now.

“I- How’d you find me? I made sure to stay off the radar… I was careful-” He babbled, holding the kitchen bench tightly, his knuckles turning white. While Natasha took another step forward towards him.

“That’s not the point. The point is to bring you back home-”

“I don’t have a home. I never did, now please… please just leave me alone,” He was slowly beginning to get irritated, no one ever listened to him. Why couldn’t he just be left alone?

“So that’s it? That’s how it’s going to end?” She began, her face filled with nothing but confusion and hurt as she walked slowly over to the physicist.

“Why, Bruce? Please just tell me why you ran, why you wont come back to me,” She was inches away from Bruce now and he could feel her hot breath on his neck, causing goosebumps to form all over.

He turned his head in guilt not looking into Natashas crystal green eyes, ones that were starting to glisten with tears.

“Because i don’t deserve you… anything that i had back-” he was going to say that word, that word that he wanted so badly but knew he could never have. If he did then it’d make it reality that he did in fact have a home, and he couldn’t live with that.

“I’m a monster, ‘Tasha. I wouldn’t be able to live with myself if i hurt you or anyone else,” He finished, as he walked over to the one chair at the dining table, leaning against it for support. He made sure to keep his breathing slow and even.

“You’re not a monster, you’re a good person. I’m not leaving without you-”

“Yes, you will. Now please… please just leave me alone,” He practically begged her, but Natasha didn’t move one inch.

“Natasha…” He said warningly, his voice deep and husky as he gripped the chair tightly.

“I am not leaving unless-”

“I SAID GO!” He bellowed, and Natasha practically jumped out of her skin from the sudden voice change.

Bruce chest moved harshly up and down at his quickened breathing, but he showed no signs of changing. not yet, at least.

Natasha watched Bruce’s movement carefully, watching for his next move. He could be so predictable but yet unpredictable at the same time. SHe knew the amount of stress he was undergoing right now, but she wouldn’t- couldn’t leave him alone out here. He finally had a home, had someone who loved him, friends who adored him, but yet he didn’t want any of it. What would she have to do to convince him?

“Bruce,” She said slowly and softly, Bruce knew how stubborn she was. She wasn’t going to give up after a little scare.

“You have friends who love you, a home, me-“ she stopped, her voice catching in her throat, god she felt so stupid being so vulnerable. It wasn’t normal for her to be like this, and Bruce saw that.

“Don’t you want any of that?” Bruce scoffed, snapping his head up to look at the assassin.

“Of course I do! But I cant put you all in any more danger, can’t you just understand that- please!”

“You’re hearing yourself right?”

Bruce frowned slightly, why couldn’t she just understand?!

“You’re talking about a god, a super soldier, two assassins and well- the Tony Stark. Do you honestly think anyone can hurt us?”

Well, she had a point. Bruce was acting as though his friends were nothing. As if they couldn’t handle someone like Ross? They were the Avengers for christ sake! But Ross wasnt just the problem, he was! He was the real monster. The monster that nobody could ever get rid of or kill.

Bruce was silent for a beat, unable to say anything other than ‘Im so sorry, i shouldnt have left you. I promise you i wont ever do it again,’. But the thing was he didnt know if he could say that. Could he live a life with Natasha? Does he deserve a life like that?

“Please, just say something-” Nat quitely spoke up, her fragie shaky voice breaking through. God, did she hate herself at the moment for being so weak and vulnerable.

But Bruce didn’t respond. Only keeping his dark glassy eyes on the chair his hands were tightly grasping. He couldn’t respond, he didn’t know how to respond.

And so with that Natasha scoffed, shaking her head upon him, tears beginning to fall down her soft cheeks.

“A coward, that’s all you are. And here i was thinking you were different from all the rest.” Natasha snarled, venom dripping from each word as she looked at Bruce carefully.

With that, Natasha left. She left behind the man she fell so deeply in love with from the day she met him. The man she felt as though she could truly be herself with. The man she had hoped would disappear and run away with. This was the man who she thought she would spend the rest of her life with.

“Is he coming?” Steve asked carefully, as she saw Natasha storm out of the run down house. He could feel the tension practically radiating from her and knew it didn’t end well.

“No.”

And so they left, hearing nothing but the distance roars of the man she will forever yearn for.

“You have friends who love you, a home, me-“ she stopped, her voice catching in her throat, god she felt so stupid being so vulnerable. It wasn’t normal for her to be like this, and Bruce saw that.

“Don’t you want any of that?” Bruce scoffed, snapping his head up to look at the assassin.

“Of course I do! But I cant put you all in any more danger, can’t you just understand that- please!”

“You’re hearing yourself right?”

Bruce frowned slightly, why couldn’t she just understand?!

“You’re talking about a god, a super soldier, two assassins and well- the Tony Stark. Do you honestly think anyone can hurt us?”

Well, she had a point. Bruce was acting as though his friends were nothing. As if they couldn’t handle someone like Ross? They were the Avengers for christ sake! But Ross wasnt just the problem, he was! He was the real monster. The monster that nobody could ever get rid of or kill.

Bruce was silent for a beat, unable to say anything other than ‘Im so sorry, i shouldnt have left you. I promise you i wont ever do it again,’. But the thing was he didnt know if he could say that. Could he live a life with Natasha? Does he deserve a life like that?

“Please, just say something-” Nat quitely spoke up, her fragie shaky voice breaking through. God, did she hate herself at the moment for being so weak and vulnerable.

But Bruce didn’t respond. Only keeping his dark glassy eyes on the chair his hands were tightly grasping. He couldn’t respond, he didn’t know how to respond.

And so with that Natasha scoffed, shaking her head upon him, tears beginning to fall down her soft cheeks.

“A coward, that’s all you are. And here i was thinking you were different from all the rest.” Natasha snarled, venom dripping from each word as she looked at Bruce carefully.

With that, Natasha left. She left behind the man she fell so deeply in love with from the day she met him. The man she felt as though she could truly be herself with. The man she had hoped would disappear and run away with. This was the man who she thought she would spend the rest of her life with.

“Is he coming?” Steve asked carefully, as she saw Natasha storm out of the run down house. He could feel the tension practically radiating from her and knew it didn’t end well.

“No.”

And so they left, hearing nothing but the distance roars of the man she will forever yearn for.

Bruce stumbled backwards, backing away as far as he could from her. Thumping hardly against the bench behind him. He had to get away. He couldn’t be here. Not with her. Not right now.

Who Shall We Kill?
Pride Prompt #12 (Avengers x Bi!Reader)
Request: I love love love the idea of pride month requests! Could you...
body:
Who Shall We Kill?

Pride Prompt #12 (Avengers x Bi!Reader)

Request: I love love love the idea of pride month requests! Could you write one (an angsty one I guess) where the reader (female, teen, and bi) is outed at school and she comes back to the tower really sad. And maybe Loki, Thor, and Peter, are all like “whAT HAPPENED WHO HURT YOU?!” And basically she explains what happened and they just comfort her? And then maybe at the end it’s just the entire tower being supportive and comforting. Lol and maybe Natasha’s like “I had a hunch.” Thanks💖

Note: Okay, remember how I said this month woud be 100 percent fluffy? Well, this one’s a bit angsty. Really, there are a lot of nasty kids in this one, but the avengers definitely make up for it, sooo enjoy <3

Tags and requests are open :D

Warnings: angst, insecurities, but I promise there’s fluff at the end

Pairing: avengers x bi!fem!teen!reader (mainly peter p., thor and loki)

Words: 1.998

Masterlist

Check out my other pride fics here :)

.

Today would be a great day. That was what you thought as you got up in the morning and sat at the breakfast table in your parent’s home eating your cereal. Your school day wouldn’t be particularly long, for the first time in ages you wouldn’t have to write an exam or hold a presentation and most important of all it was Friday and that meant you would go to the tower after school and spend the entirety of your weekend with the avengers.

So, when you got out of the bus smiling and walked up the front stairs of your school you completely missed the nasty glances or the whispers that followed you inside.

You had just turned around the corner to the floor your locker was on when your best friend rushed towards you and stopped you in your tracks by putting his hands on your shoulders. He tried to turn you around and pull you along with him but you wouldn’t budge.

“Peter, what’s going on?” You frowned.

“Please Y/N, you don’t want to go there, just let us leave or something. In fact why don’t we skip school? We’re graduating in a week and have all the important stuff done, let’s just go grab some cake and a coffee…”

You frowned at Peter’s agitated state, sure, he was always jumpy but now there was a look of panic in his eyes and you would have lied if you said it didn’t make you uneasy.

“Okay,” you gave in, “Just let me get some things…”

“No!” Peter vehemently shook his head, but before he could elaborate Flash passed you by smirking.

“Nice decoration on your locker, L/N,” he called towards you and a few guys around started to snicker.

That was it, despite of his powers you were able to yank your arm free from Peter’s grasp and pushed past the people around you. You wished you hadn’t done it, in the moment you saw the door of your locker you really really wished you had just gone for the cake.

You swallowed as you took a step closer in a dazed state. Tears pooled in your eyes as you looked over the things attached to your locker. There was a picture of you from the pride parade last weekend, you would have actually liked the photo a lot since it showed you being quite happy, a bi pride flag hung around your shoulders and your friends from the community were by your side, but someone had scribbled over it with a red sharpie in messy handwriting, now SLUT was written over your face and that wasn’t everything… Aside from the picture other insults had been sprayed over the door with graffiti spray. “Fag”, “Drag your disgusting ass out of our school” and “Abomination” were among the nicer things your classmates had come up with.

You didn’t know how long you had stood there, gaping at the sight in front of you. You had held this secret for so long, had avoided any bullying and now mere weeks before leaving your personal hell crushed down over you.

Someone gently putting his hand on your shoulder and tugging slightly brought you back into reality, the sound of laughing and voices calling names at you filled your ears, but there also was something soft, something kind.

“Let’s get out of here,” Peter spoke against your ear.

You let him pull you along with him and you barely noticed the way the hand that wasn’t holding yours was clenched into a fist at his side. His muscles were tense in anger but he tried to keep himself together for you.

It was only when you reached the exit that you registered what exactly his plan was. Immediately you halted forcing him to stop with you.

“I can’t leave,” your voice was silent but firm.

“You can’t stay Y/N, these people, they are going to be horrible!”

You nodded. “But they are going to be worse if I let them get to me, I have to manage today Peter, they’ll tear me into shreds on Monday if I run away now.”

Your friend looked worried at you. “I just want you to be safe,” he whispered.

“I know, but you know, Natasha has been giving me self-defense classes…”

Peter managed a small smile and nodded shortly. “I’ll be beside you the whole day.”

You grinned back, he truly was the best friend you could have wished for, he had always been… So far he was the only person in the world you had told about your sexuality and you were the only one knowing about him being spider-man. You were a good team and today you would prove it once again.

.

The day was… draining. While most people opted for gaping at you, some even with full blown disgust displayed on their faces, others didn’t refrain from calling you names or even get rough. Luckily you weren’t alone, Peter, Ned and MJ made sure that at least one of them were always with you and there were even a few people who gave you sympathetic smiles or nods of encouragement. Those were definitely the minority however…

You had reached the last period of your day and to your disdain your three friends all had to be somewhere else. That’s why you now stood shaking in front of the door to the changing room. Hesitantly you reached for the door handle, pushed it down and hurried into the room, at least that’s what you tried.

You hadn’t even sat two feet inside, with your head bent down to avoid as many glances as possible when one of the girls stepped up in front of you, blocking your way.

“What are you doing here? Do you think we’ll keep letting you creep on us?” the harsh voice of a tall brunette you had assumed to be rather nice until now made you look up.

“I- I don’t-“

“Cut it, nobody wants you here, just go and leave us alone, it’s the least you can do after all these years you exploited our nescience for your own purposes.”

You swallowed heavily as tears threatened to spill out of your eyes, you couldn’t quite place why after all the insults and meanness you endured that day this would throw you off as much as it did. Maybe it was the fact that you had considered the girl who threatened you now a somewhat friend, but most likely it was that for the first time the words hurled at you were true, or at least that was what you thought in that moment. It hadn’t been fair that they didn’t know, you told yourself, it had been so wrong of you, you were disgusting after all…

Without another word you left through the still open door, not caring that you had let your façade fall, not caring that the people in the hallways could see your tears. You went to the next best bathroom and locked yourself into a cubicle. Without thinking you started to dial Peter’s number, you needed him to take you away from here.

               Peter was there in a matter of seconds, not bothering that you sat in the girl’s bathroom, he came inside and knocked on the cubicle you were on, you tensed at first not sure if it was him, until he spoke up.

“It’s me, don’t worry.”

Breathing shakily you unlocked the door and stepped outside, you were immediately engulfed in a hug and for a while you simply let Peter hold you as you cried into his shoulder.

“Come on, let’s get you out of here,” Peter mumbled and pressed a kiss to your temple.

When you had nodded, he guided you outside the building and after a quick glance around he wrapped one arm around your waist and the next thing you knew was you were swinging through New York straight towards the tower.

.

You reached the tower safely but with puffy and red eyes from crying. You were feeling rather numb and if it weren’t for Peter you didn’t know if you would have managed your way upstairs.

The doors of the elevator dinged open and you walked into the kitchen to take a seat at the counter. Peter didn’t know quite what to say, so he started to fuss around you making you a cup of tea and putting a plate with cookies in front of you. You smiled thankfully at him and upon seeing how sad you looked anger flared up in the young boy.

He was about to say something when voices neared the kitchen you scrambled to make yourself look a bit more decent but of course that didn’t work. Thor and Loki entered the kitchen bantering about something, but stopped their conversation after seeing you two.

“Lady Y/N! Peter! We thought you’d be back later,” the elder of the brothers greeted you, not having had a proper look at you yet.

“Y/N?” Loki asked confused that you didn’t jump up immediately to greet them in your usual manner with a tight hug.

It was then that they had walked in enough to see you.

“What happened?” Loki crouched down beside you.

“Who hurt you?” Thor seemed furious.

“Do we have to kill someone?” Loki suggested.

“We could make it look like an accident…”

“Or not, we would also make it as public as possible, I wouldn’t have any problems with that.”

“But wait, I’ll make you a hot chocolate first…”

A teary chuckle escaped your lips and everyone was immediately a bit less tense.

Thor looked at Peter questioningly who only gave him a sad smile, he would tell them everything in your stead, but it really wasn’t his place to do that. He comfortingly rubbed over your back as you sat up a bit straighter to look at your two favorite gods. You were about to tell them about today’s occurrences when the rest of the team strolled in apparently after a team training session.

It didn’t take everyone long to access your state and fall quiet for a second before bombarding you with questions and hugs. They too suggested fairly often killing someone for you and if you wouldn’t have been so upset you certainly would have made a joke about earth’s greatest heroes turning into contract killers.

“Jesus Christ, give her some space!” Peter finally called the adults to order.

A few apologies were said after realizing they might have indeed overwhelmed you a bit, but you didn’t mind too much it was nice to be drowned in so much kindness and feel cared for after such a day.

After everyone gathered around you and Peter, it was Clint who dared to ask again.

“What happened?” he asked softly.

“I-“ Your voice was shaky from crying so much and from the fear of telling the avengers about everything, what if they would react badly as well? Sensing your doubts Loki reached for your hand and squeezed gently smiling reassuringly at you. “Today at school, uhm someone- someone found out about me being bi and outed me.”

You looked down into your lap and started to fidget with your fingers, a tear rolled down your cheek.

“Oh, sweetie,” Natasha who stood a bit behind you hugged you tightly and pressed a kiss on the top of your head.

“You- You don’t mind?” you whispered, “I mean me being bi?”

“Of course not!” A few of the guys said simultaneously.

“Why would we?” Natasha combed her fingers through your hair. “Besides it doesn’t come as much of a surprise…”

You looked up to see her give you a crooked smile.

“It doesn’t?” You deadpanned.

Natasha only laughed and hugged you again, making the others and you join in.

“So,” Tony perked up after a while, “Why don’t we order some pizza, watch a movie and talk about the best ways to turn those kid’s lives into hell?”

.

Tags: @pamplemousse-m @marvelouspottering @aspiring-bookcollector @angelklementieffs

Your school day wouldn’t be particularly long, for the first time in ages you wouldn’t have to write an exam or hold a presentation and most important of all it was Friday and that meant you would go to the tower after school and spend the entirety of your weekend with the avengers.

So, when you got out of the bus smiling and walked up the front stairs of your school you completely missed the nasty glances or the whispers that followed you inside.

You had just turned around the corner to the floor your locker was on when your best friend rushed towards you and stopped you in your tracks by putting his hands on your shoulders. He tried to turn you around and pull you along with him but you wouldn’t budge.

“Peter, what’s going on?” You frowned.

“Please Y/N, you don’t want to go there, just let us leave or something. In fact why don’t we skip school? We’re graduating in a week and have all the important stuff done, let’s just go grab some cake and a coffee…”

You frowned at Peter’s agitated state, sure, he was always jumpy but now there was a look of panic in his eyes and you would have lied if you said it didn’t make you uneasy.

“Okay,” you gave in, “Just let me get some things…”

“No!” Peter vehemently shook his head, but before he could elaborate Flash passed you by smirking.

“Nice decoration on your locker, L/N,” he called towards you and a few guys around started to snicker.

That was it, despite of his powers you were able to yank your arm free from Peter’s grasp and pushed past the people around you. You wished you hadn’t done it, in the moment you saw the door of your locker you really really wished you had just gone for the cake.

You swallowed as you took a step closer in a dazed state. Tears pooled in your eyes as you looked over the things attached to your locker. There was a picture of you from the pride parade last weekend, you would have actually liked the photo a lot since it showed you being quite happy, a bi pride flag hung around your shoulders and your friends from the community were by your side, but someone had scribbled over it with a red sharpie in messy handwriting, now SLUT was written over your face and that wasn’t everything… Aside from the picture other insults had been sprayed over the door with graffiti spray. “Fag”, “Drag your disgusting ass out of our school” and “Abomination” were among the nicer things your classmates had come up with.

You didn’t know how long you had stood there, gaping at the sight in front of you. You had held this secret for so long, had avoided any bullying and now mere weeks before leaving your personal hell crushed down over you.

Someone gently putting his hand on your shoulder and tugging slightly brought you back into reality, the sound of laughing and voices calling names at you filled your ears, but there also was something soft, something kind.

“Let’s get out of here,” Peter spoke against your ear.

You let him pull you along with him and you barely noticed the way the hand that wasn’t holding yours was clenched into a fist at his side. His muscles were tense in anger but he tried to keep himself together for you.

It was only when you reached the exit that you registered what exactly his plan was. Immediately you halted forcing him to stop with you.

“I can’t leave,” your voice was silent but firm.

“You can’t stay Y/N, these people, they are going to be horrible!”

You nodded. “But they are going to be worse if I let them get to me, I have to manage today Peter, they’ll tear me into shreds on Monday if I run away now.”

Your friend looked worried at you. “I just want you to be safe,” he whispered.

“I know, but you know, Natasha has been giving me self-defense classes…”

Peter managed a small smile and nodded shortly. “I’ll be beside you the whole day.”

You grinned back, he truly was the best friend you could have wished for, he had always been… So far he was the only person in the world you had told about your sexuality and you were the only one knowing about him being spider-man. You were a good team and today you would prove it once again.

.

The day was… draining. While most people opted for gaping at you, some even with full blown disgust displayed on their faces, others didn’t refrain from calling you names or even get rough. Luckily you weren’t alone, Peter, Ned and MJ made sure that at least one of them were always with you and there were even a few people who gave you sympathetic smiles or nods of encouragement. Those were definitely the minority however…

You had reached the last period of your day and to your disdain your three friends all had to be somewhere else. That’s why you now stood shaking in front of the door to the changing room. Hesitantly you reached for the door handle, pushed it down and hurried into the room, at least that’s what you tried.

You hadn’t even sat two feet inside, with your head bent down to avoid as many glances as possible when one of the girls stepped up in front of you, blocking your way.

“What are you doing here? Do you think we’ll keep letting you creep on us?” the harsh voice of a tall brunette you had assumed to be rather nice until now made you look up.

“I- I don’t-“

“Cut it, nobody wants you here, just go and leave us alone, it’s the least you can do after all these years you exploited our nescience for your own purposes.”

You swallowed heavily as tears threatened to spill out of your eyes, you couldn’t quite place why after all the insults and meanness you endured that day this would throw you off as much as it did. Maybe it was the fact that you had considered the girl who threatened you now a somewhat friend, but most likely it was that for the first time the words hurled at you were true, or at least that was what you thought in that moment. It hadn’t been fair that they didn’t know, you told yourself, it had been so wrong of you, you were disgusting after all…

Without another word you left through the still open door, not caring that you had let your façade fall, not caring that the people in the hallways could see your tears. You went to the next best bathroom and locked yourself into a cubicle. Without thinking you started to dial Peter’s number, you needed him to take you away from here.

               Peter was there in a matter of seconds, not bothering that you sat in the girl’s bathroom, he came inside and knocked on the cubicle you were on, you tensed at first not sure if it was him, until he spoke up.

“It’s me, don’t worry.”

Breathing shakily you unlocked the door and stepped outside, you were immediately engulfed in a hug and for a while you simply let Peter hold you as you cried into his shoulder.

“Come on, let’s get you out of here,” Peter mumbled and pressed a kiss to your temple.

When you had nodded, he guided you outside the building and after a quick glance around he wrapped one arm around your waist and the next thing you knew was you were swinging through New York straight towards the tower.

.

You reached the tower safely but with puffy and red eyes from crying. You were feeling rather numb and if it weren’t for Peter you didn’t know if you would have managed your way upstairs.

The doors of the elevator dinged open and you walked into the kitchen to take a seat at the counter. Peter didn’t know quite what to say, so he started to fuss around you making you a cup of tea and putting a plate with cookies in front of you. You smiled thankfully at him and upon seeing how sad you looked anger flared up in the young boy.

He was about to say something when voices neared the kitchen you scrambled to make yourself look a bit more decent but of course that didn’t work. Thor and Loki entered the kitchen bantering about something, but stopped their conversation after seeing you two.

“Lady Y/N! Peter! We thought you’d be back later,” the elder of the brothers greeted you, not having had a proper look at you yet.

“Y/N?” Loki asked confused that you didn’t jump up immediately to greet them in your usual manner with a tight hug.

It was then that they had walked in enough to see you.

“What happened?” Loki crouched down beside you.

“Who hurt you?” Thor seemed furious.

“Do we have to kill someone?” Loki suggested.

“We could make it look like an accident…”

“Or not, we would also make it as public as possible, I wouldn’t have any problems with that.”

“But wait, I’ll make you a hot chocolate first…”

A teary chuckle escaped your lips and everyone was immediately a bit less tense.

Thor looked at Peter questioningly who only gave him a sad smile, he would tell them everything in your stead, but it really wasn’t his place to do that. He comfortingly rubbed over your back as you sat up a bit straighter to look at your two favorite gods. You were about to tell them about today’s occurrences when the rest of the team strolled in apparently after a team training session.

It didn’t take everyone long to access your state and fall quiet for a second before bombarding you with questions and hugs. They too suggested fairly often killing someone for you and if you wouldn’t have been so upset you certainly would have made a joke about earth’s greatest heroes turning into contract killers.

“Jesus Christ, give her some space!” Peter finally called the adults to order.

A few apologies were said after realizing they might have indeed overwhelmed you a bit, but you didn’t mind too much it was nice to be drowned in so much kindness and feel cared for after such a day.

After everyone gathered around you and Peter, it was Clint who dared to ask again.

“What happened?” he asked softly.

“I-“ Your voice was shaky from crying so much and from the fear of telling the avengers about everything, what if they would react badly as well? Sensing your doubts Loki reached for your hand and squeezed gently smiling reassuringly at you. “Today at school, uhm someone- someone found out about me being bi and outed me.”

You looked down into your lap and started to fidget with your fingers, a tear rolled down your cheek.

“Oh, sweetie,” Natasha who stood a bit behind you hugged you tightly and pressed a kiss on the top of your head.

“You- You don’t mind?” you whispered, “I mean me being bi?”

“Of course not!” A few of the guys said simultaneously.

“Why would we?” Natasha combed her fingers through your hair. “Besides it doesn’t come as much of a surprise…”

You looked up to see her give you a crooked smile.

“It doesn’t?” You deadpanned.

Natasha only laughed and hugged you again, making the others and you join in.

“So,” Tony perked up after a while, “Why don’t we order some pizza, watch a movie and talk about the best ways to turn those kid’s lives into hell?”

.

Who Shall We Kill?

Pride Prompt #12 (Avengers x Bi!Reader)

Request: I love love love the idea of pride month requests! Could you write one (an angsty one I guess) where the reader (female, teen, and bi) is outed at school and she comes back to the tower really sad. And maybe Loki, Thor, and Peter, are all like “whAT HAPPENED WHO HURT YOU?!” And basically she explains what happened and they just comfort her? And then maybe at the end it’s just the entire tower being supportive and comforting. Lol and maybe Natasha’s like “I had a hunch.” Thanks💖

Note: Okay, remember how I said this month woud be 100 percent fluffy? Well, this one’s a bit angsty. Really, there are a lot of nasty kids in this one, but the avengers definitely make up for it, sooo enjoy <3

Tags and requests are open :D

Warnings: angst, insecurities, but I promise there’s fluff at the end

summary: Something I haven't been able to get out of my head since I watched (and loved I might add) The Greatest Showman in January is...
body:
Something I haven’t been able to get out of my head since I watched (and loved I might add) The Greatest Showman in January is the idea of the Avengers (new and original six) watching it one night and the very next day the training session consists of circus equipment that Tony somehow managed to acquire overnight and the movie soundtrack. Everyone else struggles with it all but Steve and Natasha take to it like absolute ducks to water (while Clint critiques from the sidelines and attempts to teach the others).


Not like an AU but the lot of them watching the movie and being like ‘we could do that’ or the classic 'How hard can it be?’ Wanda providing magical crash nets for anyone who falls, Sam thinking the aerial stuff couldn’t possibly be that hard and realising how wrong he is aND WILL SOMEBODY GET ME DOWN PLEASE!? Peter loves it at first because he can do it but gets bored quickly when he realises that since he sticks to everything anyway it’s not really a challenge for him. T'Challa makes the climb up to the top of the tight rope pole but before he can bring himself to try he just freezes and they have to coax him down. Bucky makes it onto the tightrope but ends up toppling straight off to the left since his centre of gravity is skewed from the metal arm. Rhodey is quite happy to be sitting this one out thank you very much and shares popcorn with Pepper while they watch and provide commentary. Tony seems to do well with the trapeze until Pepper notices he’s wearing parts of the nanite suit that lock into place around the bar and she calls him on it to which he responds with “You’re supposed to be MY WIFE”


The obsession only lasts a couple of weeks but every so often the equipment will sneak its way out of the store room and Tony will see it and be like “OKAY, who watched The Greatest Showman last night?”
